newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian nickel down, other base metals steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian nickel down, other base metals steady.

text.p: Indian nickel fell but other base metals were steady in range-bound trade on Friday, dealers said.
Nickel fell 100 rupees to 36,400 rupees per quintal as a fall in prices in world markets led to light profit-taking while fresh industrial buying was sluggish, they said.
Other metals were steady in light trade with copper at 13,650 rupees per quintal, zinc at 7,900 rupees and lead at 4,550 rupees per quintal, dealers said.
Sentiments were subdued on reports that state-owned agencies had lowered selling prices for May, one dealer said.

Hindustan Copper reduced selling prices of copper wire bars by 1,000 rupees per tonne and of copper rods by 2,000 rupees per tonne, while Hindustan Zinc reduced selling prices of zinc by 1,000 rupees per tonne, he said.
Tin was unchanged at 31,500 rupees and aluminium at 7,450 rupees per quintal in dull trade, dealers said.
